name: Everything Greek Pork Pitas
description: Everything Greek Pork Pitas - peppery pork with tzatziki, parsley, sun dried tomato, feta, and lemon juice. works in the Instant Pot!
keywords: greek pork pitas, pork pitas, pork sandwich
recipeIngredient: toppings of choice! like lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, feta, lemon, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Place all ingredients for the pork in a slow cooker on low heat for 10-12 hours, OR in an Instant Pot on the meat/stew setting (about 45 minutes). Shred the meat and stir it around in all those juices. YUM.

nutrition.servingSize: about 1/2 cup of the shredded pork

review.reviewBody: I made eight batches of this recipe in two slow cookers and did half pork, half turkey (which is a good substitute for pork texture wise, for those wondering). I put pitas, tzatziki, fresh sliced peppers, and a jar of homemade marinated olives in a ziploc and dropped it off to neighbours who are high risk or in self-isoloation. It received glowing reviews from everyone. I did add some water while the meat cooked to prevent scorching.
Que buena pinta Lindsay !! Siempre vuestro blog es un referente para mi.  Es un plugin el resumen de la receta al final de esta? Ya se que entiendes Español un poco ;-)

I made this exactly according to the instant pot directions (45 mins on meat/stew) and it turned out tough and had to cut it in pieces since I couldn't shred it. I'm slow-cooking the leftovers in hope of making it more tender. It's yummy with the toppings!
These look so mouth-wateringly good. I love a good slow cooker recipe and really want to do pulled pork so I think I'll start with this recipe!
